text:
On 11/29/2024 at 12:19 PM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 11/29/2024 at 12:19 PM)
Subject:Re: SafeCo Car Insurance/Split
SafeCo is billed to the Jt Account - with your portion being larger than mine. The breakdown for the amount has been shared on multiple
occasions.
All attempts and requests for reimbursement to the jt account for your larger share, as far back at Aug 16, have been ignored. My only solution
now is to formally split it.
On 11/29/2024 at 11:34 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 11/29/2024 at 12:15 PM)
Subject:Re: SafeCo Car Insurance/Split
Why would we do this before we are divorced? Are you just intentionally trying to cost us more? I don’t get you. First I offer anyway possible
not to move the boys just for their own good and you won’t let me keep you in the house even when you benefit, you have to make a big deal
out of us being divorce to SAAS because that is in their best interest somehow, and now this. I assume you wanna file separately instead of his
married too?
On 11/29/2024 at 11:30 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 11/29/2024 at 11:31 AM)
Subject:SafeCo Car Insurance/Split
I called SafeCo to understand how to split our car insurance policies.
It was set up for auto deduct on Monday, Dec 2 from jt bank account - they have paused until Dec 12th, so give us time to figure it out. I
confirmed this is a courtesy and will not impact the current coverage.
We will need to split and get own policies for each car, as single driver, so our rates will change.
Moving forward, you are of course free to choose whoever you would like for car insurance.
The sales office is closed today but will be calling me tomorrow to set up my separate account for the Subaru.
Monthly earthquake insurance is also included in jt payment, so we need to figure out how to split/pay moving forward.
Message 16 of 287
I’m ok doing that for now assuming there is no dispute about amounts or it just gets messy staying in this state.
I left message for Alex to have autopayment pull from jt account on Dec 10.
See Safeco tab in the shared workbook which breaks it down. Yours is 532, mine is 225. We should both deposit that in the joint account.
You had requested the SafeCo breakdown in an email sent by your lawyers during the last mediation.
Can you confirm no further questions or issues on this. If you are good, I’ll transfer my share into BofA.
Sent:12/02/2024 at 02:47 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/02/2024 at 02:48 PM)
Subject:Re: SafeCo Car Insurance/Split
